title: Rams
notes: Don't need much to make an affecting film. Very sad.

title: Rosemary's Baby
notes: Hail Adrian! Cracking film - loved the way it took it's time.

title: Amadeus
notes: Impressive Oscar fair, but didn't really do it for me.

title: Terms of Endearment
notes: Proper, interesting characters, superbly acted.

title: Ace in the Hole
notes: Kirk Douglas centre stage - where he likes to be, but good parable relevant as now as ever.

title: 10 Cloverfield Lane
notes: Decent bit of suspense. End felt a bit superfluous.

title: Out of Sight
notes: Enjoyable enough - thing about being cool, it's not cool to be cool. This was abit too cool.

title: The Hospital
notes: Manic seventies black comedy.

title: Eyes Without a Face
notes: Very odd with strangely stylish bits - it is French after all.

title: The Thin Red Line
notes: Entrancing visuals and strong performances in an unconventional war movie.

title: The Wicker Man
notes: Bit Groovy, bit trippy, bit funny, bit creepy. Wish I'd seen it years ago.

title: Bull Durham
notes: Sports films need chemistry, as the formula is often the same. This one had it

title: Coach Carter
notes: Plenty of the usual sports cliches, elevated by Samuel L Jackson and a slightly unconventional angle.

title: Horns
notes: Started well, was fun and different, got gradually more clunky.

title: Eye in the Sky
notes: Superbly tense throughout and through-provoking. Proper thriller.

title: Trumbo
notes: Little ponderous at times, amused that Helen Mirren obviously gave up on the accent, enough there to keep me interested.

title: Blue Jasmine
notes: Rare treat of caring about all the characters, so well written and acted.

title: Another Earth
notes: Claustrophobic, tense, atmospheric and strangely compelling.

title: Only lovers left alive
notes: Languid and cool with great music and a beautiful angle.

title: Dallas buyers club
notes: Star performances, maybe a bit too front and centre, for my taste - but still good.

title: A Bigger Splash
notes: Thoughtful character piece with a dramatic twist. Nicely done all round.

title: Nightcrawler
notes: Fantastic portrayal of a coolly ruthless character.

title: The Program
notes: Comically huge jumps in the story, and tendency to being cartoonish.

title: Ten Metre Tower
notes: Simple Idea. Great Fun

title: Youth
notes: Couldn't tell you why I liked it, but thoroughly enjoyed it

title: Moneyball
notes: In a stats mood at the mo, so watching this again.

title: Milk
notes: Pretty good and engaging performance by Sean Penn.

title: Amy
notes: Seemed fair. and so sad.

title: Arrival
notes: Nicely done throughout. Nice reveal/twist.

title: Kumiko, The Treasure Hunter
notes: Beguiling, sad,  and weirdly uplifting.

title: The Enemy Below
notes: Some really clunky philosophical dialogue, but then plenty of the usual submarine tropes are well done.

title: The Ipcress File
notes: Visually interesting throughout, sharp and cool - Michael Caine at his best. "My name is HARRY PALMER"

title: Chicago
notes: Apparently, I like musicals now.

title: Elysium
notes: Gritty, interesting start, gradually tapering off to generic. Strangely flat performance from usually great Jodie Foster.

title: A Most Wanted Man
notes: Low-key and tense with lots of good preformances from a big name cast.

title: Hoosiers
notes: Montage-tastic, with a healthy dose of eighties drums. Cheesy and enjoyable.

title: Apocalypto
notes: A non urban action film without crappy dialogue.

title: Adaption.
notes: Keeps turning inside out, but not self-consciously -  in an interesting and engaging way.

title: Lord of War
notes: Watchable, if perhaps a little jolly for what is at heart a pretty depressing trade.

title: Breathless
notes: Apparently it was revolutionary. Didn't like or care about the characters.

title: Sausage Party
notes: Funny moments - not enough to relieve the increasing boredom.

title: Crossfire
notes: Classy, if a little blunt in it's message. A message that 70 years later is sadly all too relevant.

title: The Searchers
notes: Some dodgy politics, but epic and with unexpected funny bits.

title: Secretary
notes: Fan of Maggie Gyllenhaal and more so after this. A lesser actor could have cocked it up.

title: They Might Be Giants
notes: Top marks for oddness. Strangely engaging for such a knockabout and whimsical thing.

title: Thank You for Smoking
notes: Good actors, but strangely flat -  not enough bite for a satire.

title: The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
notes: Chock full of beautifully composed scenes, with terrific performances all round and neither maudlin or uplifting - much more than that.

title: The Second Mother
notes: Good to get away from big concept, tricksy set piece films. Warm and real.

title: The Night of the Hunter
notes: Great lighting making a great looking film with a superb Robert Mitchum, but a weird ending.

title: Prisoners
notes: Nice twists and tension - So many thrillers aren't thrilling. This was certainly tense and very good.

title: Five Easy Pieces
notes: Jack Nicholson effortlessly tormented, restless and charismatic.

title: Cries and Whispers
notes: Cold, hard and distant looks abound. Claustrophobic atmosphere filled with mostly isolated and cruel people.

title: The Girl with all the Gifts
notes: Solid all round. Just right amount of action and apocalyptic pondering.

title: St. Vincent
notes: Actors I like, doing their best with a pretty sentimental by the numbers effort.

title: The Terminator
notes: Stands up well and rattles along.

title: Doctor Strange
notes: Trippy, spectacular fun.

title: The Verdict
notes: Rock solid courtroom drama, elevated by ol'blue eyes.

title: Bad Lieutenant
notes: Better than I remembered. How to make you care about a Bad man? get Harvey to act the shit out of it.

title: The Lady in the Van
notes: Tender tale about guilt, faith and loss - which was more enjoyable than I've make it sound.

title: A Most Violent Year
notes: Gripping intrigue in the 1980s New York heating oil business. No really, it was excellent.

title: Before Sunrise
notes: Mild irritation, building to annoyance. Couldn't stick it out. 1.5 stars for looking ok in bits.

title: Stroszek
notes: We are all dancing animals. Warm, funny and tragic. Wasn't sure what to expect and put me in the mood straight away.

title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
notes: Jolly good fun, once it'd built up some steam.

title: The New World
notes: Lyrical. What cleverer people than me have called his films. There's certainly some kind of elemental feeling I can't pin down, and I end up soaking in all in.

title: Black Swan
notes: Wasn't sure what to expect - it was a corker. Melodramatic in the very best way.

title: High Rise
notes: Started well, but got gradually less interesting. Reached peak montage about two thirds of the way in.

title: Brother
notes: You'd think that people who's trade is killing would be harder to kill. All in giant 90s suits. Is nihilistic Zen a thing?

title: The Insider
notes: Restless camera, pretty intrusive music, not necessarily bad things, not quite doing it for me.

title: Near Dark
notes: The baddies were the best thing about it. Honourable mention for music

title: Sink the Bismarck!
notes: Steady as she goes - probably last of the Germans = Bad, British = Good type war films.

title: The Accountant
notes: Patchy. Strong action, bit lame on the inner angst, and mixed on the plot twists. Decent fun, if a bit long.

title: Philomena
notes: Deftly done.

title: The Wind Rises
notes: Impressive animation, decent enough simple story, dragged a bit in the final third.

title: McCabe & Mrs. Miller
notes: Gritty yet domestic take on the Western genre. Interesting.

title: Elizabeth
notes: Intrigue, plotting with ruffs galore.Bit hammy at times, but that's ok.

title: Morven Callar
notes: Well that was good. Great mixing of visuals with focus and composition and audio. Once I let it wash over me it was great.

title: The Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call – New Orleans
notes: Speciality Nic Cage - charismatic unhinged spiral.

title: I Heart Huckabees
notes: Pretty wacky, and had potential to be annoying, but turned out to be great fun.

title: Blood Simple
notes: Lovely slow burn to a great climactic ending.

title: Out of the Past
notes: Stands up very well, such a cool, laconic gumshoe.

title: The Nice Guys
notes: Knockabout caper. I liked it.

title: Blind
notes: Occasionally baffling, but intriguingly funny too.

title: Logan
notes: Good old Wolverine, growling, slashing and stabbing. A Hero to us all.

title: Colossal
notes: Liked the premise and while it wasn't super subtle it had a bit of depth.

title: A Matter of Life and Death
notes: Super saturated colour, melodramatic performances and weird ideas - pretty tidy.

title: Hacksaw Ridge
notes: A feel good good war movie seems an oymoron. It was good apart from the fetishised slo-motion that seems ubiquitous in war movies these days.

title: The Infiltrator
notes: Plenty of the usual undercover tropes, but expertly handled.

title: Babel
notes: Trilogy of tragedies. Exhausting at times because of the tension, but beautifully put together.

title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
notes: Elizabeth: The Golden Age

title: Of Horses and Men
notes: Like the previous Icelandic film I watched - 'Rams' , this had moments of great comedy and tragedy. Whole thing was lovely.

title: Red Army
notes: Interesting story competently told, but couldn't help feeling there was more that the filmmaker didn't manage to get

title: Field of Dreams
notes: Just about the right side of schmaltz. Endearingly strange.

title: City of God
notes: Fast paced, snappy and stylish, which didn't wholly seem right considering the depressing subject. In the end was kinda ok about it, but a bit ambivalent

title: Monsters
notes: Not a lot happens, but interesting nonetheless. Funnily, not a monsters film.

title: Legend
notes: Tom Hardy was interesting as always, but was mostly bored and sometimes irritated.

title: Hidden Figures
notes: Really enjoyable, but couldn't shake the feeling that things should be a lot further on than they are.

title: Ivan's Childhood
notes: Beautifully composed and strangely domestic feel for a war film. I guess it isn't really a war film.

title: War Machine
notes: One of those films where if you've seen the trailer, you seen most of the best bits. Extra star for Tilda Swinton.

title: John Wick
notes: Above average for a modern action film - which isn't saying much.Kinda fun signature 'shoot 'em up close' move. Special mention for a truly awful song in the soundtrack.

title: The League of Gentlemen’s Apocalypse
notes: Satisfyingly Mental

title: The Odessa File
notes: Bit broad strokes at times, but decent enough.

title: Shell
notes: Claustraphobic in wide open space. Tense.

title: A Woman under the Influence
notes: Compelling but uncomfortable viewing. Everyone seemed on the edge at sometime. Manic.

title: Nostalgia
notes: I'm not clever enough to work what the hell is going on, but I am patient enough to let it all unfold in front of me, and open enough to be intrigued.

title: The Beckoning Silence
notes: Eloquent explanation of why people climb mountains.

title: Killer Nun
notes: Loopy, trippy and a bit nasty. Bit like the 70s.

title: Helvetica
notes: Broader than the title suggests, both a strength and a weakness.

title: Control
notes: Monochrome and monotone - Samantha Morton had depth - more than the script. Maybe cos I was unsure about watching it in the first place it felt off.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
notes: Felt longer. I guess the money spent on Faye Dunaway and Robert Duvall meant they couldn't stretch to a decent script.

title: Moana
notes: Winning combination of cheesy and trippy bundled up in brilliant animation

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
notes: I wished the jokes were as funny as the writers thought they were. And the plot was pretty thin. Apart from that, was ok.

title: Lifeboat
notes: Interesting bit of not too subtle propaganda which overdid it a bit at the end.

title: Shadows
notes: Manic and staccato energy to the whole thing, interesting but not exactly satisfying.

title: Wonder Woman
notes: What a superhero movies should be all about - bit cheesy, but with cool action scenes. So good for being different.

title: Persepolis
notes: Such subtle animation and strong story make a great package.

title: The Master
notes: A great looking exploration of a lost character and someone who claims he can help.

title: Baby Driver
notes: Is it possible to have too much music? Might be.

title: Suicide Squad
notes: Some good characters, some crap, some good actors, some crap, some good action, some crap, some good dialog some crap. everyone got a bit of stink on them.

title: Wuthering Heights
notes: Pretty gruelling. Stylistically as well as emotionally. Certainly memorable.

title: Snowden
notes: Standard bio pic, never quite sure what isreal or extra drama. Laid on thick at the end.

title: Jon Wick:Chapter 2
notes: Started annoyingly silly, got amusingly ridiculous, then a bit boring and then engagingly stupid again.

title: Shame
notes: Beautifully composed and subtly told. Loved the pacing.

title: Unbroken
notes: By the numbers bio-pic.

title: Alien: Covenant
notes: The more I see the xenomorph the less interesting it is. Fassbender is great as usual.

title: T2 Trainspotting
notes: Glad that it was good. Nearly overdid the montages, but saved it.

title: Blade Runner 2049
notes: I liked the pace and plot. Slicked back hair is evidently the sign of baddie now. Lost points for the sound - ran out of ideas and used generic too loud rumbles - crap.

title: Billion Dollar Brain
notes: Favourite bits were Michael Caine and the sixties computers, the rest was a bit too mental.

title: Ratcatcher
notes: A poetic journey through the wringer. Gotta watch it.

title: Black Narcissus
notes: Visually remarkable, lots of intense, significant looks in a full on melodrama.

title: Foxcatcher
notes: Pretty gripping, and it never felt like it was going to end well.

title: The Conversation
notes: Outstanding

title: Conspirators of Pleasure
notes: Bonkers.

title: Sightseers
notes: Had it's moments, ran out of steam a little and then picked up.

title: The Vietnam War
notes: Essential viewing

title: Eyes of Laura Mars
notes: There really was lots of everything in the seventies. Hair, smoking, rubbish, lingerie, and drama.

title: Southpaw
notes: Usual boxing tropes. Unsubtle signposting with music throughout.

title: Holy Motors
notes: way out in front for most baffling film of the year. Wierdly enjoyable.

title: Crack in the World
notes: Pretty ropey - but who doesn't like an underground science lair.

title: War Horse
notes: Schmaltzy Sunday afternoon fare.

title: Crazy Heart
notes: Simple story, made convincing with great actors.

title: Dark Horse
notes: Lovely story put together with real flair.

title: The Dance of Reality
notes: Operatic. Rather strange. Intriguing more than enjoyable.

title: We Own the Night
notes: Solid story with proper actors.

title: This Sporting Life
notes: Big presence and performances in a gritty drama.

title: Berberian Sound Studio
notes: Wonderful soundscapes. Sinister. And Italian sounds great.

title: The Man Who Wasn't There
notes: Turns out Noir is kind of soothing.

title: Heart of Glass
notes: Like a Medieval Twin Peaks episode - lots of great imagery, and gnomic statements.

title: Fury
notes: War films have a lot of tropes - this navigated them well.

title: Winter’s Bone
notes: Gritty.

title: Cachē
notes: Those long still shots.

title: The Eiger Sanction
notes: Far odder than I remembered. Patchy.

title: In a Lonely Place
notes: Tight.

title: Spellbound
notes: Rather good.

title: Oldboy
notes: Pretty amazing, bittersweet visceral journey.

title: True Romance
notes: On paper, there was a lot to like, on film it was a mess, with moments.

title: Red River
notes: Slightly lame ending.

title: El Topo
notes: Read the wikipedia page, save yourself some time. Totally bizarre, terrible sound - the occasional laugh out loud moment. I don't think I'm equipped to handle so much symbolism.

title: The Happy Film
notes: Engaging

title: Mirror
notes: Enjoyed the quiet bits the best. Entrancing shots, but the reflections and poetry left me a bit cold.

title: Lion
notes: Great looking, right side of saccharine.

title: Only God Forgives
notes: Tarantino meets Malick with a dash of Lynch.

title: Saturn 3
notes:
This is tricky. 4 starts for the fun I had watching it, 1 star for the quality.

The kind of film to get your mates round, drink and watch. Plenty of fun to be had.

title: Zero Days
notes: Interesting

title: Unforgiven
notes: Worth watching again.

title: Toy Story 3
notes: So enjoyable.

title: The Seven Five
notes: Racketeer, Drug Dealer, Burglar, Dirty Cop, but no Rat. So that's ok then.

title: The Wolverine
notes: Logan sure does carry a lot of films.

title: The Big Heat
notes: Hard-boiled. Even the dopey civilians, who were all packing. Gloria Grahame was great.

title: Lawman
notes: Bleak and rather good.

title: Under the Skin
notes: Horrifying and Mesmerising.
